title: Cricket Skill Development Instructional Design Scenarios Using Representative Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of basic physical education and understanding of cricket fundamentals
context.additional_context: A course focused on how pre-service teachers can design cricket skill training environments, with practice-based learning conducted in simulation/VR environments resembling real training settings

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the expert characteristics of cricket batting and bowling techniques and apply them when designing training tasks.
Learners can promote skill transfer by designing simulation/VR tasks that mimic real-game environments.
Learners can develop training programs incorporating task variability, decision-making elements, and principles of information source utilization.

resources: High-Fidelity VR Headsets and Motion Trackers

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
